metadata.feature_description: Displays statistics about tag usage across community content with pagination support

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View tag statistics for different time periods

steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard loads with Trending Tags section visible
steps.actual: Dashboard loaded successfully showing Trending Tags section for each social module

steps.action: Click on period selector and select 'Week'
steps.expected: Tag statistics display for Week period
steps.actual: Period selector shows Week option selected, date range updated to show weekly period

steps.action: Click on period selector and select 'Month'
steps.expected: Tag statistics display for Month period
steps.actual: Period changed to Month, date range updated showing monthly period (Jan 10 - Feb 9)

steps.action: Click on period selector and select 'Year'
steps.expected: Tag statistics display for Year period
steps.actual: Period changed to Year, date range updated showing yearly period (Feb 9, 2025 - Feb 9, 2026)

steps.action: Examine Trending Tags section for pagination controls
steps.expected: Pagination controls should be visible when there are enough tag results
steps.actual: Pagination controls exist in the DOM but are hidden (display: none) because there is no tag data. Code confirms pagerVisible observable controls visibility based on totalResults > pageSize

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Compare tag usage between time periods

steps.action: Click on Comparative Term dropdown and change from '1 w' to '1 m'
steps.expected: Comparative term should change and data should refresh
steps.actual: Comparative Term dropdown successfully changed from '1 w' to '1 m', dashboard refreshed with new comparative period

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test empty state when no tags exist

steps.action: View Trending Tags section when no tag data exists
steps.expected: Empty state message should display indicating no tags are available
steps.actual: All social modules (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki) display 'No trending tags available in selected period' empty state message correctly

steps.action: Verify empty state across all modules
steps.expected: Each module should show appropriate empty state
steps.actual: Confirmed empty state displays consistently across Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, and Wiki modules

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify tag count accuracy and display

steps.action: Examine Trending Tags horizontal bar chart area
steps.expected: Tag counts should be displayed accurately with bar chart visualization
steps.actual: Trending Tags section shows empty SVG chart area with 'No trending tags available in selected period' message. This is correct behavior when no tag data exists in the analytics warehouse

steps.action: Verify pagination controls behavior with current data state
steps.expected: Pagination should handle datasets correctly, hiding when insufficient data
steps.actual: Pagination controls correctly hidden when no data exists. Code review confirms pagination uses pageIndex and pageSize parameters with pagerVisible observable that shows controls only when totalResults exceeds pageSize. This is correct behavior.

observations: The Trending Tags section uses D3.js horizontal bar charts for visualization
Pagination controls are correctly hidden via knockout observable 'pagerVisible' when there is insufficient data (totalResults <= pageSize)
The API endpoint GetTagStats accepts period, comparativeTerm, startDate, endDate, pageIndex, and pageSize parameters
All 6 social modules (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki) have their own Trending Tags sections
Empty state message 'No trending tags available in selected period' displays consistently across all modules
Time period options include Day, Week, Month, Year, and Custom with date picker
Comparative Term dropdown allows comparing current period against previous periods (1 w, 1 m, 1 y depending on selected period)
Testing was performed with empty tag data state - sorting functionality could not be verified without populated data
